name: Island City House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights here last Dec. It was fairly quiet, although our room in the Arch House was on the street side of the building. There are several good places to eat within walking distance, and we never actually used the car at all. Which is good, because parking was very difficult to find. The breakfast was average, but the outdoor seating area was quite attractive. The room itself was true to the web site description.
reviews.title: Nice Place, but Too Congested for Us
Great stay...
reviews.text: While we had no problems during our stay, we would not stay here again just because of the location. We would prefer a less congested area of town.

reviews.title: Very charming and enjoyable
reviews.text: Great find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are historic, but still quite modern. The ONLY exception is the terrible cable TV service. They had two modern flat screen TVs in my room, but the cable picture was all snowy. This hotel should switch to satellite or get a repairman out there. It's terrible.
reviews.title: charming, historic and beautiful

likes.disliked: — would like to see an afternoon tea, it is such beautiful surroundings after a busy day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The included breakfast was fantastic. Served in the courtyard.
reviews.title: Great place to unwind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night and it was amazing!
reviews.title: Excellent, would stay again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Full kitchen, living room, full bath with tub, bathroom with a full size closet and 2 flat screen TVs.
reviews.title: F*A*N*T*A*S*T*I*C--We Loved The Island City House--

likes.liked: — The rooms are great. Beds are very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place was very well designed and tastefully decorated. We found no faults in this establishment and will stay here the next time we visit Key West.
reviews.title: Recommend the Island City House

likes.liked: — Close to action, but far enough away to be relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also comes with Continental Breakfast.
reviews.title: Beautiful retreat
Loved the carriage house!
reviews.text: It is close to the Duval St. which is the main strip. People who were staying here were not the loud partying type.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights at The Island City House. We made an excellent choice...Our 3rd floor room in the Cigar House was perfect, roomy and very comfortable with pleasant decor. The kitchen/living area was equipped with everything needed to settle right in and the balcony overlooking the pool was a relaxing place to be. Breakfast each morning in the garden was a treat and you couldn't find a nicer setting to begin your day, very peaceful. We had a great time in Key West and enjoyed meeting really nice people at the hotel.
reviews.title: Truly Charming!
Wonderful Place!
reviews.text: The parking situation isn't the best, but we were always able to find a spot, although it was sometimes a couple of blocks away. This would not keep us from visiting this hotel again though, as the ambiance of this place makes up for the inconvenience in a big way. We highly recommend The Island City House and hope to visit again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in the ICH 2 bedroom suite and the room was wonderful. Granite work tops, lovely wooden furniture and really clean. The private porch was lovely to relax on after walking about all day. It was really hot and so the pool was lovely for cooling off. The breakfast was really nice in the courtyard setting although they could do with another couple of tables. This wasn't a problem though as you could take breakfast up to your porch to eat if you have one. Key west is lovely. The old houses are really nice to look at sitting on the tree linjed streets. ICH is close enough to the action on Duval street but far enough away to escape the hustle and bustle! Would def recommend.
reviews.title: Amazing!

likes.liked: — The gardens, location and the rooms

reviews.text: Can not say enough about this hotel. From the moment we arrived we loved it. The rooms are great and the we loved having the private porch. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Pool was great as well. This is one of the most romantic hotels I have ever stayed in. If you are looking for a place to stay in Key West, look no more!! We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: our wedding trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I got married in May in Key West. We stayed at Island City House for 6 days. We were in the Island City building as well as another family that were with us. The location is great. It is quiet on William Street, and just a short walk to the seaport.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! What a surprise! With the price of this place I didn't expect much. But we were very pleasantly surprised. I surprised my husband for his birthday and we had such a great time. It is not like your typical bed and breakfast where you know everyone staying there. It is much less personal, which we liked. Some people were down for breakfast, but we just got ours and went to our room.
reviews.title: Awesome Choice!

likes.liked: — how nice it was compared to the price, it was like an apartment
likes.disliked: — maid service left the last guest's food on top of fridge, but it was all sealed so it wasn't so bad

reviews.text: The room is AWESOME! Very large with a great updated kitchen. It is a bit more than a few blocks from Duvall, but we walked there many times. We usually rented the bikes available for $12/day and would get there in a few minutes. In fact, we had our bikes stolen at Sloppy Joes and when we were expecting to have to purchase the two bikes, the front desk lady was more than nice and they actually found them and did not charge us. People really do steal them, so be careful.
reviews.title: Just as described on their web page

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, helpful staff and the location
likes.disliked: — Parking could be an issue as you can only park in non marked bays

reviews.text: The beds weren't the best, and we heard the people above us in the morning ( we were second floor in the cigar house) but after walking past several other bed and breakfasts, we knew we were so lucky to find such a nice place at such a great price.
reviews.title: Great Place, Great Service!

likes.disliked: — I really enjoyed my stay! I have nothing to complain about!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk is so nice and helfpul and the grounds are beautiful. We will definately be staying here the next time we visit.
reviews.title: Charming & Quiet... within easy walking distance of Hustle & Bustle

likes.liked: — It's best qualities are the calm environment, cleanliness, and proximity to Duval St.
likes.disliked: — I wish it has workout facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a GREAT irish place around the corner (it is on their suggested eating menu which you will find in your room) and I had the BEST chicken pot pie I have ever had! And I am from the south!
reviews.title: Can't Wait to Go Back to the Island City House Hotel

likes.disliked: — Too many kids in the pool

description: Unique Hotel Complex encompassing Island City House, a Victorian-era Mansion, Arch House, an 1880s Carriage House & Cigar House.
